main event: A brilliant white object was observed by the pilot and co-pilot of a T-33 jet while on a routine training mission over the Atlantic Ocean. It appeared cigar-shaped and remained motionless in the sky.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on 7 November 1951 at approximately 25,000 feet altitude., The pilot stated that no radar contact was established in the area., The object was described as being approximately the size of a C-54 aircraft., Both the pilot and co-pilot monitored the object for 10 to 15 minutes before it disappeared., The investigation indicated that the phenomena might have been an aircraft, but no firm conclusion was reached.
witness description: pilot and co-pilot of a T-33 jet
